publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4800 Margaret Smith: Changing Faces—That the Parliament acknowledges the launch of the Scottish branch of the charity, Changing Faces, on Tuesday 19 September 2006 at Edinburgh City Chambers; notes that over 400,000 people in the United Kingdom live with a disfigurement and that Changing Faces is a charity which, through extensive experience and research, has developed techniques to allow people living with disfigurement to build their confidence and self-esteem; recognises that Changing Faces has been at the forefront of efforts to ensure that the emotional and social needs of people living with disfigurement are addressed, and urges MSPs to support the charity.

S2M-4800 Margaret Smith: Changing Faces—That the Parliament acknowledges the launch of the Scottish branch of the charity, Changing Faces, on Tuesday 19 September 2006 at Edinburgh City Chambers; notes that over 400,000 people in the United Kingdom live with a disfigurement and that Changing Faces is a charity which, through extensive experience and research, has developed techniques to allow people living with disfigurement to build their confidence and self-esteem; recognises that Changing Faces has been at the forefront of efforts to ensure that the emotional and social needs of people living with disfigurement are addressed, and urges MSPs to support the charity. Supported by: Robin Harper*, Fiona Hyslop*, Mike Pringle*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, John Swinburne*, Nora Radcliffe*, Susan Deacon*, Frances Curran*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-4800 Changing Faces (lodged on 14 September 2006) Trish Godman*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-4800 Changing Faces (lodged on 14 September 2006) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-4800 Changing Faces (lodged on 14 September 2006) Margaret Jamieson*
S2M-4800 Changing Faces (lodged on 14 September 2006) Tommy Sheridan*
